swefun.cardgames.playingcards

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • swefun.cardgames.playingcards.Hand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Card>

    public class Hand
extends Object
implements Iterable<Card>
    A hand comprised of cards. A hand is also represented by a unique long integer value.
    Version:
    1.4 $Id: Hand.java 295 2017-03-24 21:26:19Z jody $
    Author:
    Dr. Jody Paul

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hand()
      Construct a hand of default size from a default deck of cards.

      Hand copy constructor.
      Hand(int handSize)
      Construct a hand of specified size from a default deck of cards.
      Hand(int handSize, Deck fromDeck)
      Construct a hand from the beginning of a given deck.
      Hand(int handSize, Deck fromDeck, int start)
      Construct a hand given a deck and a starting position within that deck.
      Hand(long encoding)
      Create a new hand given a hand encoding.

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Two hands are considered equivalent if they both contain equivalent cards in the same order.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to compare with this hand
        Returns:

        public final Card getCard(int which)
        Retrieve the card at a given position within this hand.

        Precondition: 0 ≤ which ≤ size of hand

        Parameters:
        which - the index of the desired card
        Returns:
        the card at the specified index or at index 0 if precondition is not met
